intro: Echinopsilon muricatus, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, bristly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry, disturbed soils. Echinopsilon muricatus is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
